document_data.name: Hatori
document_data.mainbody: '''Sand [[crocodile]]s''', or '''''hatori''''' ({{SingPl}}) in [[Old Alzhedo]], were terrifying, armored reptiles found in the [[Calim Desert]] in the time of the [[Calim Empire]]. With their camouflaged scales, they buried themselves under the [[sand]]s, only to erupt violently and grab their prey with their teeth. Then they would disappear under the sand again, dragging their catch with them.
document_data.Description:
These enormous creatures were called crocodiles of the sand, but their bodies more closely resembled [[lizard]]s'. Their legs had the form of flippers which allowed them to easily move through sands in swimming motions, while they had to travel over solid ground gracelessly flopping forward. Their eyes are within deep-set cavities in their skull.

Their resilient knobby scales had various colors of sand and stone, from red-brown to grayish-white. Together with their long thin tails, lesser ''hatori'' were {{SI|10|'}} to {{SI|50|'}} in length, while specimen of up to {{SI|200|'}} long were found in the greater variety. ''Hatori'' grew slowly and continously throughout their long lives.
document_data.Behavior:
Living in deserts, ''hatori'' usually made their territory at places where they could expect food like migrating animals or caravans.

These reptiles only mate once every ten years, after  intense battles fought between the males deep in the desert. The parents went their separate ways afterwards, but the females care for their offspring until it reaches about 50 years of age.
document_data.Combat: To hunt for food ''hatori'' hid themselves below the sand and between the rocks of their habitat to surprise their prey. Their coloration made this camouflage very effective. They attacked with their powerful tail and bit with their enormous jaws, often swallowing victims whole.
document_data.Ecology: ''Hatori'' stood at the top of the food chain in their habitat, except possibly [[dragon]]s living in the same area, or sometimes other ''hatori''. Their habit of swallowing everything edible also meant that they sometimes had valuables resistant to digestion inside their intestines.
document_data.Greater and Lesser ''Hatori'': Crocodiles of the sands were sometimes distinguished into lesser and greater ''hatori'', depending on their size, with a length of {{SIrange|50|60|ft}} being the dividing line. These were not two different races, however, but simply younger and older specimen.
document_data.Rumors and Legends: There were rumors that a place existed where old ''hatori'' went to die. If it existed, it would certainly contain many valuables once ingested by the great reptiles.
document_data.Trivia: The [[Hatori (guild)|Hatori]] guild of assassins were named after these fearsome reptiles.
